intro: Scabiosa ucranica var. gmelinii, commonly known as the Ukrainian scabious, is a perennial flowering plant native to eastern Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders. Its blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
